Errors in drown test : False
True if errors occured while running drowntests

Not vulnerable to Drown attack
See https://drownattack.com/

False
DHE or ECDHE parameter reuse saves some CPU (more so for ECDHE than for DHE) at the theoretical expense of a weakening of the 'forward secrecy' rule, which is considered not a problem as long as the reused parameters are cached in RAM only and the server implementation does not leak information on the selected DH/ECDH secret key even when faced with invalid values from the client.

TLS_FALLBACK_SVC support : True
Indicates if the endpoint supports TLS_FALLBACK_SVC to prevent a downgrade attack

Forward Secrecy support : * Forward Secrecy is achieved with modern clients. For example, the server supports ECDHE suites, but not DHE.
This is based on client simulation results

Not vulnerable to FREAK attack
If a host is vulnerable to this attack is support 512-bit key exchange. See: https://freakattack.com/
